intro: Cyrtandra utriculosa, commonly known as the bladderfruit or Hawaiian bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its unique, inflated fruit that resembles a small bladder. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. Its flowers are usually showy, with distinct petals and a tubular corolla. Cyrtandra utriculosa plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
